Posts.Content: May 17, 2008 06:01PM lusianagal wrote: i am on avastin, today i blew my nose and it was nothing but blood, but i thought it might have just been a sinus thing, it really wasnt a nose bleed.  I was on avastin before and had to be put on blood pressure meds b/c of it.  I am to on it twice a month.
Posts.Title: Surprise AVASTIN tx today! badboob67 ali_lpn

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2009 08:33PM lusianagal wrote: I have been on avastin but not Abraxane.  I just finished 33 treatments of taxol and avastin, no hair, no nails, no energy.  I was on methitest for 4 months and did not get a good PET scan result, so now i am on taxotere and cytoxin as well as the metitest.  Welll it was nice to have hair for a couple of months anyway!!  I have mets to bones and one small spot on the liver.  I have been dx for 2 years.  Im so glad you have good news, i will pray that your positive news continues!! todd
Posts.Title: Abraxane/Avastin may be working waterlily Reneepals

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2009 08:35PM lusianagal wrote: I had avastin and never had any abdominal pain.  I had bone and joint pain though.  I lost my fingernails, toenails, and hair.  Be careful with Zometa, i developed necrosis of the jaw and it is horrible!! And the claritin, who new???
Posts.Title: Abraxane/Avastin may be working waterlily Reneepals

Posts.Content: lusianagal wrote: I have been through one treatment of avastin/taxol and one treatment of taxol only.  The double treatment slammed me pretty hard on the third day out, but the taxol alone wasnt bad at all.  Anyone out ther on the same schedule? If this works will they continue this three week treatment indefinitely?? its kind of inconvenient, BUT THIS WHOLE THING IS INCONVENIENT, WHO AM I KIDDING?? Posts.Content: lusianagal wrote: After 7 months of taxol and avastin, no hair, and now losing my toenails and fingernails, the dr, after a great pet scan said we will begin andogen(sp)  Im a little worried about the side effects ive read about.  Anyone out there on it?  How is it?   I did get some good news.  I am going on sabbatical next semester and then i am retiring.  At 50 it seems too soon but i need some QOL  ya know!! Posts.Content: May 8, 2008 02:23PM lusianagal wrote: i just started on avastin and taxol.  The dr says the dose is so minimal that my hair may not fall out....who knows......who cares, id rather have air than hair i had taxol 8 yrs ago with a/cytoxin and did not have any neuropathy that time and this dose is less so maybe none this time.  I had to be taken off of zometa due to osteonecrosis of the jaw, so i take 1500 of calcium and only and extra vitamin D.  Im hoping to keep things stable now.  this is my second time around i was dx with invasive stage 2 in 99.  hopefully we can stay stable now.
